transcripts.text: New Beginning is a show, a short show, that we were looking at doing three years ago, having a tie-in with a curriculum that we have done called Ange's Bible Curriculum.  The general plot behind everything is the real-life account, not a story, but the account of the pre-flood and the flood and the post-flood with the family that is on the ark.

One of the things that really struck me was that there were eight people that lived through this very traumatic experience.  And only one of which do we know that much about.  We know a little bit about his sons, Noah's sons.  But we really don't know anything about the sons' wives.  And I thought that was really interesting just because they went through it as well.
We wanted to put something in a different element than what people were normally hearing.  So that was a female's shoes.

Shem's wife, which is Ariel, needed to express her emotions really clear and well because she's narrating the history before, during, and after the flood.  It's a privilege to represent Ariel of Shem's wife.

One of the big pieces that we read scripture and we sometimes totally miss the real life aspect of the account that is shown in the flood.  This was a biggest cataclysmic thing that happened in the world.

The thing I want people to appreciate is that Noah was a real human being.  His family was real.  I think the world sometimes think that he was this make-believe character or some kind of myth, and he was real.  And God extended mercy then through Noah and brought people, saved mankind.  So I hope people really appreciate how God still extends that mercy today.

I would like the film to encourage people the faith of Christians.  Noah's account shows good examples of faith, courage, discipline.  Noah was a preacher of righteousness.  Nowadays we have the privilege to preach the Gospel of Jesus Christ and that is the only message that can save the heart.  Thank you.
